pullRequest.body:
This PR adds `isPretransitive_of_compHom` after the related `isPretransitive_compHom`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7619404144/job/20752406467)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7619410068/job/20752422737)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7619410068/job/20752422577)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7619410068/job/20752423025)

This name will make it possible to use new-style dot notation:
```suggestion
theorem IsPretransitive.of_compHom
```
Also, I think that we should have `MulActionHom.isPretransitive` instead of this lemma.
`MulActionHom` is for when one group acts on two sets, and you have an equivariant map between the sets. But here we have two groups acting on one set, and a group homomorphism between the groups.

You're right but I think that we should have a version that doesn't assume definitional equalities anyway. Something like (not tested)
```
theorem IsPretransitive.of_smul_eq {M N Î± : Type*} [SMul M Î±] [SMul N Î±]
    [IsPretransitive M Î±] (f : M â†’ N) (hf : âˆ€ {c : M} {x : Î±}, f c â€¢ x = c â€¢ x) :
    IsPretransitive N Î± :=
```
with corollaries for `of_compHom` and `IsScalarTower` (do we already have it?).
And while you're on it, please add versions about `IsTransitive`.

Also, please use `M`, `N` for monoids and `Î±` for a type without any structure.

Thanks! I've added this version you suggested. I'm not sure what the `IsScalarTower` version would be (since an `IsScalarTower M N Î±` doesn't come with a function `f : M â†’ N`). And I thought that mathlib didn't have `IsTransitive`, only `IsPretransitive`.

You're right about `IsTransitive`. About `IsScalarTower`: in this case `f x = x â€¢ 1` and the required equality is provided by [smul_one_smul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Defs.html#smul_one_smul).
Ah, of course. Thanks!

```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun x y â†¦ (exists_smul_eq x y).elim fun m h â†¦ âŸ¨f m, hf.trans hâŸ©âŸ©
```

You can use the same TC assumptions as in `smul_one_smul`. Otherwise LGTM. Thanks!
bors d+
```suggestion
theorem MulAction.IsPretransitive.of_isScalarTower (M : Type*) {N Î± : Type*} [Monoid N] [SMul M N]
    [MulAction N Î±] [SMul M Î±] [IsScalarTower M N Î±] [IsPretransitive M Î±] :
    IsPretransitive N Î± :=
```
